5f3baf48-ece2-4a1f-b3b1-72e9f9662c85.name: Choose either fit or very fit

dd2957bc-3287-436b-9acd-ba771e35be88.name: Fit
dd2957bc-3287-436b-9acd-ba771e35be88.notes: Recover FP at twice the normal rate (but not FP spent for spells or psi powers)

features.situation: to all HT rolls to stay conscious, avoid death, resist disease, or resist poison

90610f0f-1560-4a19-8ed7-5816b8c0111b.name: Very Fit
90610f0f-1560-4a19-8ed7-5816b8c0111b.notes: +2 to all HT rolls to stay conscious, avoid death, resist disease, resist poison; recover FP at twice the normal rate; lose FP at half the normal rate (in both cases, not FP spent for spells or psi powers)

907536d0-358c-40fa-a48d-6491756ee107.name: Hard to Kill
907536d0-358c-40fa-a48d-6491756ee107.notes: Up to level 3 +1/level to HT rolls made for survival at -HP or below, and on any HT roll where failure means instant death (due to heart failure, poison, etc.). If this bonus makes the difference between success and failure, you collapse, apparently dead (or disabled), but come to in the usual amount of time. A successful Diagnosis roll reveals the truth.

b9691fd8-b51f-4181-a116-fe65778be6c7.name: Hard to Subdue
b9691fd8-b51f-4181-a116-fe65778be6c7.notes: Up to level 3 +1/level to any HT roll to avoid unconsciousness – whether as a result of injury, drugs, or ultra-tech weapons – and to resist supernatural abilities that cause unconsciousness

de0ef6c9-048a-4a62-ada5-f69bace9f065.name: High Pain Threshold
de0ef6c9-048a-4a62-ada5-f69bace9f065.notes: Never suffer shock penalties when injured

features.situation: on all HT rolls to avoid knockdown and stunning

01f8e316-ca85-454d-bb3f-e0126e0584bf.name: Choose either rapid healing or very rapid healing

e2ee9168-3c48-48d7-aa5c-503b509dc0bf.name: Very Rapid Healing
e2ee9168-3c48-48d7-aa5c-503b509dc0bf.notes: Whenever you roll to recover lost HP or to see if you can get over a crippling injury, you get +5 to your effective HT. When you roll to recover lost HP, a successful HT roll means you heal 2 HP, not 1.

b46813cd-9263-4bd0-b4bf-732950eb3cdd.name: Rapid Healing
b46813cd-9263-4bd0-b4bf-732950eb3cdd.notes: Whenever you roll to recover lost HP or to see if you can get over a crippling injury, you get +5 to your effective HT

595a10ba-72ed-4d40-9b87-6cfd5f9a56ac.name: Recovery
595a10ba-72ed-4d40-9b87-6cfd5f9a56ac.notes: When determining the length of time you remain unconscious for any reason, divide all times by 60

c31911e9-8550-42a0-afd8-2eb14db61207.name: Berserk
c31911e9-8550-42a0-afd8-2eb14db61207.notes: Make a self-control roll any time you suffer damage over 1/4 your HP in the space of one second, and whenever you witness equivalent harm to a loved one

14cfb0f2-fec0-4a15-b5da-6acb5d868363.name: Bloodlust
14cfb0f2-fec0-4a15-b5da-6acb5d868363.notes: You must make a self-control roll whenever you need to accept a surrender, evade a sentry, take a prisoner, etc.

f7a9293c-bc54-4b29-a763-773e210c2a29.name: Code of Honor (Soldier's)
f7a9293c-bc54-4b29-a763-773e210c2a29.notes: An officer should be tough but fair, lead from the front, and look out for his men; an enlisted man should look out for his buddies and take care of his kit. Every soldier should be willing to fight and die for the honor of his unit, service, and country; follow orders; obey the “rules of war”; treat an honorable enemy with respect (a dishonorable enemy deserves a bullet); and wear the uniform with pride.

features.situation: from victims of your intolerance (may be as much as -5, at GM's discretion)
from others in any situation where No Sense of Humor becomes evident

f3a03c27-9250-40ab-8251-cf0d6b71741a.name: On the Edge
f3a03c27-9250-40ab-8251-cf0d6b71741a.notes: Make a self-control roll whenever you face a life-threatening situation: piloting a burning vehicle, staring down an entire street gang while armed only with a toothbrush, etc. If you fail, you may not back down from the challenge – but you may roll again after every success roll or reaction roll relating to the situation. In combat, make a self-control roll every time you take your turn. If you fail, you must make an All-Out attack or engage in some other kind of near-insane, suicidal behavior.

features.situation: from others if they witness your On the Edge behavior, unless it is someone who values bravery over self-preservation (GM’s decision), who will react at +2 instead

257bc411-8b38-43b0-a410-53cdd228d504.name: One Eye
257bc411-8b38-43b0-a410-53cdd228d504.notes: -1 to DX in combat and on any task involving hand-eye coordination, and -3 on ranged attacks (unless you Aim first) and on rolls to operate any vehicle faster than a horse and buggy.

b799655b-ee83-4bec-8392-0db3a153839d.name: Overconfidence
b799655b-ee83-4bec-8392-0db3a153839d.notes: You must make a self-control roll any time the GM feels you show an unreasonable degree of caution. If you fail, you must go ahead as though you were able to handle the situation!

features.situation: from young or naive individuals who believe you are as good as you say you are
from victims of your intolerance (may be as much as -5, at GM's discretion)
